p: Transchromosomic cattle have been developed to produce fully human polyclonal IgG antibodies following immunization ( Matsushita et al., 2014). Using this technology, polyclonal sera containing antibodies against the spike protein of MERS-CoV were produced (SAB-301) and demonstrated to be effective in neutralizing the virus in vitro and reducing lung virus titers in infected mice ( Luke et al., 2016). A phase 1 randomized clinical trial aimed to evaluate the safety and tolerability of SAB-301 was conducted (NCT02788188). Results have been published and showed that the polyclonal human antibody is safe and well tolerated in patients at what could be considered therapeutic doses ( Beigel et al., 2018).
